posts.post_content:
So, if you have no other creatures in play, you've essentially got a 5/5 for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)... not exactly confidence-inspiring. It's fairly versatile in how it allows you to distribute the +1/+1 counters, but honestly, it is just way too expensive to make that worthwhile.
  
   
Consider your other ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) options **at common**:

[Siege Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Siege Wurm)   
[Wirewood Guardian](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wirewood Guardian)   
   
Pick one of them instead. Any of them.

posts.post_content:
At least the +1/+1 counters have pseudo-haste when you put them on un-sick creatures. She's no [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart), though.  
  
Unless you're getting janky with [Reveillark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reveillark), [Stampeding Wildebeests](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stampeding Wildebeests), or [flicker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=240030) effects, you're probably better off with [Incremental Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incremental Growth), [Vigor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vigor), [Jugan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jugan), [liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=147439)s, [Fangren Firstborn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fangren Firstborn), or [Blessings of Nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blessings of Nature).  
  
It's a fun effect, though. I'd love to see an updated version: ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) for a 1/1 that distributes five or six counters.
posts.html:
At least the +1/+1 counters have pseudo-haste when you put them on un-sick creatures. She's no Wolfir Silverheart, though.

Unless you're getting janky with Reveillark, Stampeding Wildebeests, or flicker effects, you're probably better off with Incremental Growth, Vigor, Jugan, lieges, Fangren Firstborn, or Blessings of Nature.

It's a fun effect, though. I'd love to see an updated version: for a 1/1 that distributes five or six counters.
